Translation: Pass my greetings to your children.
You're afraid to pull up the net, aren't you?
Orig_Translation: you are afraid to pull up the net, aren't you?
I'm with you (more than one person).

Translation: I almost go (but I am not going to go).
I said (to myself), “Kaywerye evidently doesn't like me”.

Sentence: oná wyaro nkekoná báryekomo, táyoná wya
Segmentation: onɨ wjaro n-ka-jakonɨ bɨrʲekomo tɨ-jonɨ wja
Translation: This is what the boy said to his mother.
Orig_Gloss: this like he-said-it boy his-mother to

Comment: Syllable reduction and assimilation of ‘to fly’?

Translation: I always bathe in this river.
Orig_Translation: Eu me banho sempre nesse rio

Translation: “Did s/he leave?”, I say to him.
Orig_Translation: '¿Será que se fue? le dije a él.'

Translation: Then I was already grown up.
